title: A Marketing Wonder: Timothée Chalamet’s ‘Marty Supreme’ Passes Up ‘One Battle After Another’ at U.S.  Box Office
summary: Chalamet, working with director Josh Safdie and A24, came up with a number of bold viral marketing stunts that have seen the original film smash one record after another since it's nationwide release on Christmas Day.

title: Enverus: Venezuela To Increase Oil Output 50% By 2035
summary: Industry consultant Enverus has predicted that Venezuela will increase oil production 50% and hit 1.5 million barrels a day by 2035 following the capture of long-time leader Nicolas Maduro by the Trump administration. title: Kazakhstan Cut December Oil Output By 230 Kb/d
summary: Kazakhstan cut oil production in December by more than 200 Kb/d, with output averaging 1.522 million barrels per day in the final month down from 1.759 mb/d in November. title: EIA Shows Crude Oil Inventories Continue to Rise
summary: Crude oil inventories in the United States increased by 3.4 million barrels during the week ending January 14, according to new data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) released on Wednesday. title: China’s Imports of Venezuelan Oil Set to Crumble
summary: China is expected to see a plunge in imports of oil from Venezuela in February as the now month-long U.S. blockade has prevented many China-bound cargoes from leaving Venezuelan waters. title: Shell and Exxon Cancel North Sea Gas Asset Sale to Viaro Energy
summary: ExxonMobil and Shell have decided not to proceed with a planned sale of their joint assets in the southern UK North Sea to Viaro Energy. title: Indian Oil Corporation Turns to Ecuador to Fill Russian Crude Gap
summary: India’s largest state-owned refiner, Indian Oil Corporation (IOC), has bought its first-ever crude from Ecuador as it seeks to replace part of its Russian crude deliveries with supplies from as far as South America.
